   21: %% This is a development feature when developing a new file module,
   22: %% ugly but practical.
   23: -ifndef(FILE_MODULE).
   24: -define(FILE_MODULE, file).
   25: -endif.
   26: -ifndef(FILE_SUITE).
   27: -define(FILE_SUITE, file_SUITE).
   28: -endif.
   29: -ifndef(FILE_INIT).
   30: -define(FILE_INIT(Config), Config).
   31: -endif.
   32: -ifndef(FILE_FINI).
   33: -define(FILE_FINI(Config), Config).
   34: -endif.
   35: -ifndef(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE).
   36: -define(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   37: -endif.
   38: -ifndef(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE).
   39: -define(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   40: -endif.
   41: 
   42: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   43: 
   44: -module(?FILE_SUITE).

  131: suite() ->
  132:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},

  147: groups() ->

  149: 		 list_dir, list_dir_error, untranslatable_names,
  150: 		 untranslatable_names_error]},

  152:       [{group, open}, {group, pos}, {group, file_info},
  153:        {group, consult}, {group, eval}, {group, script},
  154:        truncate, sync, datasync, advise, allocate, allocate_file_size]},
  155:      {open, [],
  156:       [open1, old_modes, new_modes, path_open, close, access,
  157:        read_write, pread_write, append, open_errors,
  158:        exclusive]},

  174:        read_cooked_tar_problem, read_not_really_compressed,

  183: 
  184: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  185:     Config.
  186: 
  187: end_per_group(bench, Config) ->
  188:     ScratchDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  189:     file:delete(filename:join(ScratchDir, "benchmark_scratch_file")),
  190:     Config;
  191: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  192:     Config.
  193: 
  194: 
  195: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     SaslConfig = case application:start(sasl) of
  197: 		     {error, {already_started, sasl}} ->
  198: 			 [];
  199: 		     ok ->
  200: 			 [{sasl,started}]
  201: 		 end,
  202:     application:start(os_mon),
  203: 
  204:     case os:type() of
  205: 	{win32, _} ->
  206: 	    Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  207: 	    HasAccessTime =
  208: 		case ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Priv) of
  209: 		    {ok, #file_info{atime={_, {0, 0, 0}}}} ->
  210: 			%% This is a unfortunately a FAT file system.
  211: 			[no_access_time];
  212: 		    {ok, _} ->
  213: 			[]
  214: 		end,
  215: 	    ?FILE_INIT(HasAccessTime++Config++SaslConfig);
  216: 	_ ->
  217: 	    ?FILE_INIT(Config++SaslConfig)
  218:     end.
  219: 
  220: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     case os:type() of
  222: 	{win32, _} ->
  223: 	    os:cmd("subst z: /d");
  224: 	_ ->
  225: 	    ok
  226:     end,
  227: 
  228:     application:stop(os_mon),
  229:     case proplists:get_value(sasl, Config) of
  230: 	started ->
  231: 	    application:stop(sasl);
  232: 	_Else ->
  233: 	    ok
  234:     end,
  235:     ?FILE_FINI(Config).
  236: 
  237: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  238:     %%error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  239:     ?FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  240: 
  241: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  242:     %% error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p END *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  243:     ?FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  244: 
  245: %% Matches a term (the last) against alternatives
  246: expect(X, _, X) ->
  247:     X;
  248: expect(_, X, X) ->
  249:     X.
  250: 
  251: expect(X, _, _, X) ->
  252:     X;
  253: expect(_, X, _, X) ->
  254:     X;
  255: expect(_, _, X, X) ->
  256:     X.
  257: 
  258: expect(X, _, _, _, X) ->
  259:     X;
  260: expect(_, X, _, _, X) ->
  261:     X;
  262: expect(_, _, X, _, X) ->
  263:     X;
  264: expect(_, _, _, X, X) ->
  265:     X.
  266: 
  267: %% Calculate the time difference
  268: time_dist({YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}, DT) ->
  269:     time_dist({{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}}, DT);
  270: time_dist(DT, {YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}) ->
  271:     time_dist(DT, {{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}});
  272: time_dist({_D1, _T1} = DT1, {_D2, _T2} = DT2) ->
  273:     calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT2)
  274: 	- calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT1).
  275: 
  276: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  277: mini_server(Parent) ->
  278:     receive
  279: 	die ->
  280: 	    ok;
  281: 	{io_request,From,To,{put_chars,_Encoding,Data}} ->
  282: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{put_chars,Data}},
  283: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, ok},
  284: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  285: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_chars,_Encoding,'',N}} ->
  286: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_chars,'',N}},
  287: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, lists:duplicate(N,$a)}},
  288: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  289: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_line,_Encoding,''}} ->
  290: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_line,''}},
  291: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, "hej\n"}},
  292: 	    mini_server(Parent)
  293:     end.
  294: 
  295: %% Test that standard i/o-servers work with file module.
  296: standard_io(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  297:     %% Really just a smoke test
  298:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,mini_server,[self()]),
  299:     register(mini_server,Pid),
  300:     ok = file:write(mini_server,<<"hej\n">>),
  301:     receive
  302: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  303: 	    ok
  304:     after 1000 ->
  305: 	    exit(noreply)
  306:     end,
  307:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(mini_server,5),
  308:     receive
  309: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  310: 	    ok
  311:     after 1000 ->
  312: 	    exit(noreply)
  313:     end,
  314:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(mini_server),
  315:     receive
  316: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  317: 	    ok
  318:     after 1000 ->
  319: 	    exit(noreply)
  320:     end,
  321:     OldGL = group_leader(),
  322:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  323:     ok = file:write(standard_io,<<"hej\n">>),
  324:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  325:     receive
  326: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  327: 	    ok
  328:     after 1000 ->
  329: 	    exit(noreply)
  330:     end,
  331:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  332:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(standard_io,5),
  333:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  334:     receive
  335: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  336: 	    ok
  337:     after 1000 ->
  338: 	    exit(noreply)
  339:     end,
  340:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  341:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(standard_io),
  342:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  343:     receive
  344: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  345: 	    ok
  346:     after 1000 ->
  347: 	    exit(noreply)
  348:     end,
  349:     Pid ! die,
  350:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
  351: 
  352: %% Test that the old file IO protocol =< R16B still works.
  353: old_io_protocol(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  354:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  355:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  356: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  357: 			 ++"old_io_protocol.fil"),
  358:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
  359:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
  360:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
  361:     Fd ! {file_request,self(),Fd,truncate},
  362:     receive
  363: 	{file_reply,Fd,ok} -> ok
  364:     end,
  365:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  366:     {ok, <<>>} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  367:     [] = flush(),
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: unicode_mode(Config) ->
  371:     Dir = {dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
  372:     OptVariants = [[Dir],
  373: 		   [Dir, {encoding, utf8}],
  374: 		   [Dir, binary],
  375: 		   [Dir, binary, {encoding, utf8}]
  376: 		  ],
  377:     ReadVariants = [{read, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read(Fd1, 1024) end) end},
  378: 		    {read_line, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read_line(Fd1) end) end}
  379: 		    %%{pread, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, 0, 1024) end},
  380: 		    %%{preadl, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, [{0, 1024}]) end},
  381: 		   ],
  382: 
  383:     _ = [read_write_0("ASCII: list:  Hello World", Read, Opt) ||
  384: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  385:     _ = [read_write_0("LATIN1: list: åäöÅÄÖ", Read, Opt) ||
  386: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  387:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"ASCII: bin: Hello World">>, Read, Opt) ||
  388: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  389:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"LATIN1: bin: åäöÅÄÖ">>, Read, Opt) ||
  390: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  391:     %% These will be double encoded if option is encoding utf-8
  392:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"UTF8: bin: Ωß"/utf8>>, Read, Opt) ||
  393: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  394:     %% These should not work (with encoding set to utf-8)
  395:     %%   according to file's documentation
  396:     _ = [read_write_0("UTF8: list: Ωß", Read, Opt) ||
  397: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: read_write_0(Str, {Func, ReadFun}, Options) ->
  401:     try
  402: 	Res = read_write_1(Str, ReadFun, Options),
  403: 	io:format("~p: ~ts ~p '~p'~n", [Func, Str, tl(Options), Res]),
  404: 	ok
  405:     catch {fail, Line, ReadBytes = [_|_]} ->
  406: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~w vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  407: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  408: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  409: 	  {fail, Line, ReadBytes} ->
  410: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~ts vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  411: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  412: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  413: 	  error:What:Stacktrace ->
  414: 	    io:format("~p:??: ~p ERROR: ~p from~n  ~w~n  ~p~n",
  415: 		      [?MODULE, Func, What, Str, Options]),
  416: 
  417: 	    io:format("\t~p~n", [Stacktrace]),
  418: 	    exit({error, ?LINE})
  419:     end.
  420: 
  421: read_write_1(Str0, ReadFun, [{dir,Dir}|Options]) ->
  422:     File = um_filename(Str0, Dir, Options),
  423:     Pre = "line 1\n", Post = "\nlast line\n",
  424:     Str = case is_list(Str0) andalso lists:max(Str0) > 255 of
  425: 	      false ->  %% Normal case Use options
  426: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write|Options]),
  427: 		  IO = [Pre, Str0, Post],
  428: 		  ok = file:write(FdW, IO),
  429: 		  case is_binary(Str0) of
  430: 		      true -> iolist_to_binary(IO);
  431: 		      false -> lists:append(IO)
  432: 		  end;
  433: 	      true -> %% Test unicode lists
  434: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write]),
  435: 		  Utf8 = unicode:characters_to_binary([Pre, Str0, Post]),
  436: 		  file:write(FdW, Utf8),
  437: 		  {unicode, Utf8}
  438: 	  end,
  439:     file:close(FdW),
  440:     {ok, FdR} = file:open(File, [read|Options]),
  441:     ReadRes = ReadFun(FdR),
  442:     file:close(FdR),
  443:     Res = um_check(Str, ReadRes, Options),
  444:     file:delete(File),
  445:     Res.
  446: 
  447: 
  448: um_read(Fd, Fun) ->
  449:     um_read(Fd, Fun, []).
  450: 
  451: um_read(Fd, Fun, Acc) ->
  452:     case Fun(Fd) of
  453: 	eof ->
  454: 	    case is_binary(hd(Acc)) of
  455: 		true  -> {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))};
  456: 		false -> {ok, lists:append(lists:reverse(Acc))}
  457: 	    end;
  458: 	{ok, Data} ->
  459: 	    um_read(Fd, Fun, [Data|Acc]);
  460: 	Error ->
  461: 	    Error
  462:     end.
  463: 
  464: 
  465: um_check(Str, {ok, Str}, _) -> ok;
  466: um_check(Bin, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_binary(Bin), is_list(Res) ->
  467:     case list_to_binary(Res) of
  468: 	Bin -> ok;
  469: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  470:     end;
  471: um_check(Str, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_list(Str), is_binary(Res) ->
  472:     case iolist_to_binary(Str) of
  473: 	Res -> ok;
  474: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  475:     end;
  476: um_check({unicode, Utf8Bin}, Res, Options) ->
  477:     um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, Res,
  478: 		     proplists:get_value(binary, Options, false),
  479: 		     proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, none));
  480: um_check(_Str, Res, _Options) ->
  481:     ?THROW_ERROR(Res).
  482: 
  483: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, Utf8Bin}, true, none) ->
  484:     ok;
  485: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, List = [_|_]}, false, none) ->
  486:     case binary_to_list(Utf8Bin) == List of
  487: 	true -> ok;
  488: 	false -> ?THROW_ERROR(List)
  489:     end;
  490: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {error, {no_translation, unicode, latin1}}, _, _) ->
  491:     no_translation;
  492: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, Error = {error, _}, _, _Unicode) ->
  493:     ?THROW_ERROR(Error);
  494: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {ok, _ListOrBin}, _, _UTF8_) ->
  495:     %% List = if is_binary(ListOrBin) -> unicode:characters_to_list(ListOrBin);
  496:     %% 	      true -> ListOrBin
  497:     %% 	   end,
  498:     %% io:format("In: ~w~n", [binary_to_list(Utf8Bin)]),
  499:     %% io:format("Ut: ~w~n", [List]),
  500:     ?THROW_ERROR({shoud_be, no_translation}).
  501: 
  502: um_filename(Bin, Dir, Options) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  503:     um_filename(binary_to_list(Bin), Dir, Options);
  504: um_filename(Str = [_|_], Dir, Options) ->
  505:     Name = hd(string:lexemes(Str, ":")),
  506:     Enc = atom_to_list(proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, latin1)),
  507:     File = case lists:member(binary, Options) of
  508: 	       true ->
  509: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_bin_enc_" ++ Enc;
  510: 	       false ->
  511: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_list_enc_" ++ Enc
  512: 	   end,
  513:     filename:join(Dir, File).
  514: 
  515: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  516: 
  517: read_write_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  518:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  519:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  520: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  521: 			 ++"_read_write_file"),
  522: 
  523:     %% Try writing and reading back some term
  524:     SomeTerm = {"This term",{will,be},[written,$t,$o],1,file,[]},
  525:     Bin1 = term_to_binary(SomeTerm),
  526:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin1),
  527: 
  528:     %% Try a "null" term
  529:     NullTerm = [],
  530:     Bin2 = term_to_binary(NullTerm),
  531:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin2),
  532: 
  533:     %% Try reading a nonexistent file
  534:     Name2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  535: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  536: 			  ++"_nonexistent_file"),
  537:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name2),
  538:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(""),
  539:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(''),
  540: 
  541:     %% Try writing to a bad filename
  542:     {error, enoent} = do_read_write_file("", Bin2),
  543: 
  544:     %% Try writing something else than a binary
  545:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, {1,2,3}),
  546:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, self()),
  547: 
  548:     %% Some non-term binaries
  549:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, []),
  550: 
  551:     %% Write some iolists
  552:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, [Bin1,[],[[Bin2]]]),
  553:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, ["string",<<"binary">>]),
  554:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, "pure string"),
  555: 
  556:     [] = flush(),
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: do_read_write_file(Name, Data) ->
  560:     case ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data) of
  561: 	ok ->
  562: 	    BinData = iolist_to_binary(Data),
  563: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  564: 
  565: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  566: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  567: 
  568: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  569: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  570: 
  571: 	    ok;
  572: 	{error,_}=Res ->
  573: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  574: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  575: 	    Res
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  579: 
  580: 
  581: make_del_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  583:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  584: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  585: 			   ++"_mk-dir"),
  586:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  587:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  588:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  589:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  590:     %% Make sure we are not in a directory directly under test_server
  591:     %% as that would result in eacces errors when trying to delete '..',
  592:     %% because there are processes having that directory as current.
  593:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  594:     {ok,CurrentDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  595:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260 } of
  596: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  597: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH)\n", []),
  598: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  599:     	_ ->
  600: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir)
  601:     end,
  602:     try
  603: 	%% Check that we get an error when trying to create...
  604: 	%% a deep directory
  605: 	NewDir2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  606: 				atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  607: 				++"_mk-dir-noexist/foo"),
  608: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir2),
  609: 	%% a nameless directory
  610: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(""),
  611: 	%% a directory with illegal name
  612: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir({1,2,3}),
  613: 
  614: 	%% a directory with illegal name, even if it's a (bad) list
  615: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([1,2,3,{}]),
  616: 
  617: 	%% Maybe this isn't an error, exactly, but worth mentioning anyway:
  618: 	%% ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([$f,$o,$o,0,$b,$a,$r])),
  619: 	%% The above line works, and created a directory "./foo"
  620: 	%% More elegant would maybe have been to fail, or to really create
  621: 	%% a directory, but with a name that incorporates the "bar" part of
  622: 	%% the list, so that [$f,$o,$o,0,$f,$o,$o] wouldn't refer to the same
  623: 	%% dir. But this would slow it down.
  624: 
  625: 	%% Try deleting some bad directories
  626: 	%% Deleting the parent directory to the current, sounds dangerous, huh?
  627: 	%% Don't worry ;-) the parent directory should never be empty, right?
  628: 	case ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir('..') of
  629: 	    {error, eexist} -> ok;
  630: 	    {error, eacces} -> ok;		%OpenBSD
  631: 	    {error, einval} -> ok			%FreeBSD
  632: 	end,
  633: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(""),
  634: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir([3,2,1,{}]),
  635: 
  636: 	[] = flush()
  637:     after
  638: 	?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(CurrentDir)
  639:     end,
  640:     ok.
  641: 
  642: make_del_dir_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  643:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  644:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING ++ "_make_del_dir_r"),
  645:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  646: 
  647:     %% Create:
  648:     %% newdir/
  649:     %%     file1
  650:     %%     dir/
  651:     %%         file2
  652:     %%         link -> /newdir/file1
  653:     File1 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "file1")),
  654:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File1, <<"file1">>),
  655:     Dir = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "dir")),
  656:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(Dir),
  657:     File2 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "file2")),
  658:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File2, <<"file2">>),
  659:     Link = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "link")),
  660:     case ?FILE_MODULE:make_symlink(File1, Link) of
  661:         {error, enotsup} -> ok; % symlinks not supported
  662:         {error, eperm} -> {win32, _} = os:type(), ok; % not allowed to make symlinks
  663:         ok -> ok
  664:     end,
  665: 
  666:     %% check that del_dir_r/1 succeeds on non-empty dir
  667:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(Dir),
  668:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Dir),
  669:     %% check that the symlink wasn't followed
  670:     {ok, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(File1),
  671: 
  672:     %% clean up
  673:     ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(NewDir),
  674:     [] = flush(),
  675:     ok.
  676: 
  677: cur_dir_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  678:     %% Find out the current dir, and cd to it ;-)
  679:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  680:     Dir1 = BaseDir ++ "", %% Check that it's a string
  681:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  682: 
  683:     %% Make a new dir, and cd to that
  684:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  685:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  686: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  687: 			   ++"_curdir"),
  688:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  689:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260} of
  690: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  691: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH):\n"),
  692: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  693: 	_ ->
  694: 	    io:format("cd to ~s",[NewDir]),
  695:     	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  696: 
  697: 	    %% Create a file in the new current directory, and check that it
  698: 	    %% really is created there
  699: 	    UncommonName = "uncommon.fil",
  700: 	    {ok,Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(UncommonName,read_write),
  701: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  702: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  703: 	    true = lists:member(UncommonName,NewDirFiles),
  704: 
  705: 	    %% Ensure that we get the same result with a trailing slash; the
  706: 	    %% APIs used on Windows will choke on them if passed directly.
  707: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("./"),
  708: 
  709: 	    %% Delete the directory and return to the old current directory
  710: 	    %% and check that the created file isn't there (too!)
  711: 	    expect({error, einval}, {error, eacces}, 
  712: 	    	   ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir)),
  713: 	    ?FILE_MODULE:delete(UncommonName),
  714: 	    {ok,[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  715: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  716: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  717: 
  718: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  719: 	    {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  720: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  721: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  722: 	    {ok,OldDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  723: 	    false = lists:member(UncommonName,OldDirFiles)
  724:     end,
  725: 
  726:     %% Try doing some bad things
  727:     {error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd({foo,bar}),
  728:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(""),
  729:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(".......a......"),
  730:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(), %% Still there?
  731: 
  732:     %% On Windows, there should only be slashes, no backslashes,
  733:     %% in the return value of get_cwd().
  734:     %% (The test is harmless on Unix, because filenames usually
  735:     %% don't contain backslashes.)
  736: 
  737:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  738:     false = lists:member($\\, BaseDir),
  739: 
  740:     [] = flush(),
  741:     ok.
  742: 
  743: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd/1.
  744: 
  745: cur_dir_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  746:     case os:type() of
  747: 	{win32, _} ->
  748: 	    win_cur_dir_1(Config);
  749: 	_ ->
  750: 	    {error, enotsup} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd("d:")
  751:     end,
  752:     [] = flush(),
  753:     ok.
  754: 
  755: win_cur_dir_1(_Config) ->
  756:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  757: 
  758:     %% Get the drive letter from the current directory,
  759:     %% and try to get current directory for that drive.
  760: 
  761:     [CurDrive,$:|_] = BaseDir,
  762:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([CurDrive,$:]),
  763:     io:format("BaseDir = ~s\n", [BaseDir]),
  764: 
  765:     %% We should error out on non-existent drives. Any reasonable system will
  766:     %% have at least one.
  767:     CurDirs = [?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([Drive,$:]) || Drive <- lists:seq($A, $Z)],
  768:     lists:member({error,eaccess}, CurDirs),
  769: 
  770:     %% Unfortunately, there is no way to move away from the
  771:     %% current drive as we can't use the "subst" command from
  772:     %% a SSH connection. We can't test any more.
  773: 
  774:     ok.
  775: 
  776: 
  777: %%%
  778: %%% Test list_dir() on a non-existing pathname.
  779: %%%
  780: 
  781: list_dir_error(Config) ->
  782:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  783:     NonExisting = filename:join(Priv, "non-existing-dir"),
  784:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(NonExisting),
  785:     ok.
  786: 
  787: %%%
  788: %%% Test list_dir() and list_dir_all().
  789: %%%
  790: 
  791: list_dir(Config) ->
  792:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  793:     TestDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_list_dir"),
  794:     ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(TestDir),
  795:     list_dir_1(TestDir, 42, []).
  796: 
  797: list_dir_1(TestDir, 0, Sorted) ->
  798:     [ok = ?FILE_MODULE:delete(filename:join(TestDir, F)) ||
  799: 	F <- Sorted],
  800:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(TestDir);
  801: list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt, Sorted0) ->
  802:     Base = "file" ++ integer_to_list(Cnt),
  803:     Name = filename:join(TestDir, Base),
  804:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Base),
  805:     Sorted = lists:merge([Base], Sorted0),
  806:     {ok,DirList0} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(TestDir),
  807:     {ok,DirList1} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir_all(TestDir),
  808:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList0),
  809:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList1),
  810:     list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt-1, Sorted).
  811: 
  812: untranslatable_names(Config) ->
  813:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  814: 	false ->
  815: 	    untranslatable_names_1(Config);
  816:         os ->
  817: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  818:         fs ->
  819:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  820:     end.
  821: 
  822: untranslatable_names_1(Config) ->
  823:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  824:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  825:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names"),
  826:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  827:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"]),
  828:     try
  829: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  830: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  831: 
  832: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  833: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  834: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  835: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  836: 	ExpectedListDir = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  837: 
  838: 	ExpectedListDirAll0 = [case Enc of
  839: 				   utf8 ->
  840: 				       unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8);
  841: 				   latin1 ->
  842: 				       N
  843: 			       end || {Enc,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  844: 	ExpectedListDirAll = lists:sort(ExpectedListDirAll0),
  845: 	io:format("ExpectedListDirAll: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDirAll]),
  846: 	ExpectedListDirAll = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir_all, [Dir])
  847:     after
  848: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  849: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  850: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  851: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  852:     end,
  853:     ok.
  854: 
  855: untranslatable_names_error(Config) ->
  856:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  857: 	false ->
  858: 	    untranslatable_names_error_1(Config);
  859:         os ->
  860: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  861:         fs ->
  862:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  863:     end.
  864: 
  865: untranslatable_names_error_1(Config) ->
  866:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  867:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  868:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names_error"),
  869:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  870:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnue"]),
  871:     try
  872: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  873: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  874: 
  875: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  876: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  877: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  878: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  879: 	{error,{no_translation,BadFile}} =
  880: 	    rpc:call(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  881: 	true = lists:keymember(BadFile, 2, untranslatable_names())
  882: 
  883:     after
  884: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  885: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  886: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  887: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  888:     end,
  889:     ok.
  890: 
  891: untranslatable_names() ->
  892:     [{utf8,<<"abc">>},
  893:      {utf8,<<"def">>},
  894:      {utf8,<<"Lagerl",195,182,"f">>},
  895:      {utf8,<<195,150,"stra Emterwik">>},
  896:      {latin1,<<"M",229,"rbacka">>},
  897:      {latin1,<<"V",228,"rmland">>}].
  898: 
  899: call_and_sort(Node, M, F, A) ->
  900:     {ok,Res} = rpc:call(Node, M, F, A),
  901:     lists:sort(Res).
  902: 
  903: no_untranslatable_names() ->
  904:     case os:type() of
  905: 	{unix,darwin} -> os;
  906: 	{win32,_} -> os;
  907: 	_ ->
  908:             %% If we are using utf8only on zfs then we cannot create latin1 characters.
  909:             case os:find_executable("zfs") of
  910:                 false ->
  911:                     false;
  912:                 _Zfs ->
  913:                     case os:cmd("zfs get utf8only `pwd` | grep utf8only | awk '{print $3}'") of
  914:                         "on" ++ _ ->
  915:                             fs;
  916:                         _ ->
  917:                             false
  918:                     end
  919:             end
  920:     end.
  921: 
  922: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  923: 
  924: 
  925: 
  926: open1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  927:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  928:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  929: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  930: 			   ++"_files"),
  931:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  932:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  933:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
  934:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  935:     Str = "{a,tuple}.\n",
  936:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
  937:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  938:     Str = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  939:     Str = io:get_line(Fd2,''),
  940:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  941:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  942:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd1),
  943:     eof = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  944:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  945:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  946:     eof = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
  947:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  948:     [] = flush(),
  949:     ok.
  950: 
  951: %% Tests all open modes.
  952: 
  953: old_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  954:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  955:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  956: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  957: 			   ++"_old_open_modes"),
  958:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  959:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  960:     Marker = "hello, world",
  961: 
  962:     %% write
  963:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, write),
  964:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  965:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  966:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  967: 
  968:     %% read
  969:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read),
  970:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
  971:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  972: 
  973:     %% read_write
  974:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read_write),
  975:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
  976:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
  977:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  978: 
  979:     [] = flush(),
  980:     ok.
  981: 
  982: 
  983: new_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  984:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  985:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  986: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  987: 			   ++"_new_open_modes"),
  988:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  989:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  990:     Marker = "hello, world",
  991: 
  992:     %% write
  993:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
  994:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  995:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  996:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  997: 
  998:     %% read
  999:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1000:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
 1001:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1002: 
 1003:     %% read and write
 1004:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1005:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
 1006:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
 1007:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1008: 
 1009:     %% read by default
 1010:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, []),
 1011:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd4, prompt),
 1012:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd4),
 1013: 
 1014:     %% read and binary
 1015:     {ok, Fd5} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, binary]),
 1016:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd5, prompt),
 1017:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd5),
 1018: 
 1019:     %% read, raw
 1020:     {ok, Fd6} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, raw]),
 1021:     {ok, [$\[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd6, 1),
 1022:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd6),
 1023: 
 1024:      %% write and sync
 1025:      case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write, sync]) of
 1026: 	 {ok, Fd7} ->
 1027: 	     ok = io:write(Fd7, Marker),
 1028: 	     ok = io:put_chars(Fd7, ".\n"),
 1029: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd7),
 1030: 	     {ok, Fd8} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1031: 	     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd8, prompt),
 1032: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd8);
 1033: 	 {error, enotsup} ->
 1034: 	     %% for platforms that don't support the sync option
 1035: 	     ok
 1036:      end,
 1037: 
 1038:      % open directory
 1039:      {ok, Fd9} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [directory]),
 1040:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd9),
 1041: 
 1042:      % open raw directory
 1043:      {ok, Fd10} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [raw, directory]),
 1044:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd10),
 1045: 
 1046:      [] = flush(),
 1047:      ok.
 1048: 
 1049: path_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1050:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1051:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1052: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1053: 			   ++"_path_open"),
 1054:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1055:     FileName = "path_open.fil",
 1056:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1057:     {ok,Fd1,_FullName1} =
 1058: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1059: 	   [RootDir,
 1060: 	    "nosuch1",
 1061: 	    NewDir],FileName,write),
 1062:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1063:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1064: 
 1065:     %% locate it in the last dir
 1066:     {ok,Fd2,_FullName2} =
 1067: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1068: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1069: 	    NewDir,
 1070: 	    RootDir],FileName,read),
 1071:     {ok,2} =
 1072: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1073:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1074:     %% Try a failing path
 1075:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1076: 			 ["nosuch1",
 1077: 			  NewDir],FileName,read),
 1078:     %% Check that it's found regardless of path, if an absolute name given
 1079:     {ok,Fd3,_FullPath3} =
 1080: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1081: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1082: 	    NewDir],Name,read),
 1083:     {ok,2} =
 1084: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd3,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd3,'',1),
 1085:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1086: 
 1087:     [] = flush(),
 1088:     ok.
 1089: 
 1090: close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1091:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1092:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1093: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1094: 			 ++"_close.fil"),
 1095:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
 1096:     %% Just closing it is no fun, we did that a million times already
 1097:     %% This is a common error, for code written before Erlang 4.3
 1098:     %% because then ?FILE_MODULE:open just returned a Pid, and not everyone
 1099:     %% really checked what they got.
 1100:     {'EXIT',_Msg} = (catch ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close({ok,Fd1})),
 1101:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1102: 
 1103:     %% Try closing one more time
 1104:     Val = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1105:     io:format("Second close gave: ~p",[Val]),
 1106: 
 1107:     %% All operations on a closed raw file should EINVAL, even if they're not
 1108:     %% supported on the current platform.
 1109:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, write, raw]),
 1110:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1111: 
 1112:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:advise(Fd2, 5, 5, normal),
 1113:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:allocate(Fd2, 5, 5),
 1114:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1115:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 1116:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 1117:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(Fd2, 5, 1),
 1118:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(Fd2, 5, "einval please"),
 1119:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd2, 1),
 1120:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:sync(Fd2),
 1121:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 1122:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:write(Fd2, "einval please"),
 1123: 
 1124:     [] = flush(),
 1125:     ok.
 1126: 
 1127: access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1128:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1129:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1130: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1131: 			 ++"_access.fil"),
 1132:     Str = "ABCDEFGH",
 1133:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1134:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
 1135:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1136:     %% Check that we can't write when in read only mode
 1137:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1138:     case catch io:format(Fd2,"XXXX",[]) of
 1139: 	ok ->
 1140: 	    ct:fail({format,write});
 1141: 	_ ->
 1142: 	    ok
 1143:     end,
 1144:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1145:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1146:     Str = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
 1147:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1148: 
 1149:     [] = flush(),
 1150:     ok.
 1151: 
 1152: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:read/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:write/2.
 1153: 
 1154: read_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1155:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1156:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1157: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1158: 			   ++"_read_write"),
 1159:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1160:     Marker = "hello, world",
 1161:     MarkerB = list_to_binary(Marker),
 1162: 
 1163:     %% Plain file.
 1164:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1165:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1166:     read_write_test(Fd1, Marker, []),
 1167: 
 1168:     %% Raw file.
 1169:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1170:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1171:     read_write_test(Fd2, Marker, []),
 1172: 
 1173:     %% Plain binary file.
 1174:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-b.fil"),
 1175:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [read, write, binary]),
 1176:     read_write_test(Fd3, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1177: 
 1178:     %% Raw binary file.
 1179:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-b.fil"),
 1180:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [read, write, raw, binary]),
 1181:     read_write_test(Fd4, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1182: 
 1183:     ok.
 1184: 
 1185: read_write_test(File, Marker, Empty) ->
 1186:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write(File, Marker),
 1187:     {ok, 0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(File, 0),
 1188:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1189:     {ok, Marker} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1190:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1191:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1192:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1193:     [] = flush(),
 1194:     ok.
 1195: 
 1196: 
 1197: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:pread/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite/2.
 1198: 
 1199: pread_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1200:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1201:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1202: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1203: 			   ++"_pread_write"),
 1204:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1205:     List = "hello, world",
 1206:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
 1207: 
 1208:     %% Plain file.
 1209:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1210:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1211:     pread_write_test(Fd1, List),
 1212: 
 1213:     %% Raw file.
 1214:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1215:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1216:     pread_write_test(Fd2, List),
 1217: 
 1218:     %% Plain file. Binary mode.
 1219:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-binary.fil"),
 1220:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [binary, read, write]),
 1221:     pread_write_test(Fd3, Bin),
 1222: 
 1223:     %% Raw file. Binary mode.
 1224:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-binary.fil"),
 1225:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [binary, read, write, raw]),
 1226:     pread_write_test(Fd4, Bin),
 1227: 
 1228:     ok.
 1229: 
 1230: pread_write_test(File, Data) ->
 1231:     io:format("~p:pread_write_test(~p,~p)~n", [?MODULE, File, Data]),
 1232:     Size = if is_binary(Data) -> byte_size(Data);
 1233: 	      is_list(Data) -> length(Data)
 1234: 	   end,
 1235:     I = Size + 17,
 1236:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, 0, Data),
 1237:     {ok, Data} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, 0, I),
 1238:     {ok, [Data]} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, I}]),
 1239:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, I, 1),
 1240:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, [{0, Data}, {I, Data}]),
 1241:     {ok, [Data, eof, Data]} =
 1242: 	?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, Size}, {2*I, 1}, {I, Size}]),
 1243:     Plist = lists:seq(21*I, 0, -I),
 1244:     Pwrite = lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Data}end, Plist),
 1245:     Pread = [{22*I,Size} | lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Size}end, Plist)],
 1246:     Presult = [eof | lists:map(fun(_)->Data end, Plist)],
 1247:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, Pwrite),
 1248:     {ok, Presult} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, Pread),
 1249:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1250:     [] = flush(),
 1251:     ok.
 1252: 
 1253: %% Test appending to a file.
 1254: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1255:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1256:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1257: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1258: 			   ++"_append"),
 1259:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1260: 
 1261:     First = "First line\n",
 1262:     Second = "Second lines comes here\n",
 1263:     Third = "And here is the third line\n",
 1264: 
 1265:     %% Write a small text file.
 1266:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "a_file.txt"),
 1267:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
 1268:     ok = io:format(Fd1, First, []),
 1269:     ok = io:format(Fd1, Second, []),
 1270:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1271: 
 1272:     %% Open it a again and a append a line to it.
 1273:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [append]),
 1274:     ok = io:format(Fd2, Third, []),
 1275:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1276: 
 1277:     %% Read it back and verify.
 1278:     Expected = list_to_binary([First, Second, Third]),
 1279:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name1),
 1280: 
 1281:     [] = flush(),
 1282:     ok.
 1283: 
 1284: open_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1285:     DataDir =
 1286: 	filename:dirname(
 1287: 	  filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "x")),
 1288:     DataDirSlash = DataDir++"/",
 1289:     {error, E1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [read]),
 1290:     {error, E2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [read]),
 1291:     {error, E3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [write]),
 1292:     {error, E4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [write]),
 1293:     {eisdir,eisdir,eisdir,eisdir} = {E1,E2,E3,E4},
 1294: 
 1295:     Real = filename:join(DataDir, "realmen.html"),
 1296:     {error, enotdir} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Real, [directory]),
 1297: 
 1298:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ?FILE_MODULE:open("foo", [raw, ram])),
 1299:     [] = flush(),
 1300:     ok.
 1301: 
 1302: %% Test exclusive access to a file.
 1303: exclusive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1304:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1305:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1306: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1307: 			   ++"_exclusive"),
 1308:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1309:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "ex_file.txt"),
 1310:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1311:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1312:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1313:     ok.
 1314: 
 1315: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1316: 
 1317: 
 1318: pos1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1319:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1320:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1321: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1322: 			 ++"_pos1.fil"),
 1323:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1324:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1325:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1326:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1327: 
 1328:     %% Start pos is first char
 1329:     io:format("Relative positions"),
 1330:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1331:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,1}),
 1332:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1333:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-3}),
 1334:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1335:     %% Backwards from first char should be an error
 1336:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1337:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1338:     %% Reset position and move again
 1339:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0),
 1340:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,2}),
 1341:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1342:     %% Go a lot forwards
 1343:     {ok,13} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,10}),
 1344:     eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1345: 
 1346:     %% Try some fixed positions
 1347:     io:format("Fixed positions"),
 1348:     {ok,8} =
 1349: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,8), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1350:     {ok,8} =
 1351: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,cur), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1352:     {ok,7} =
 1353: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,7), "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1354:     {ok,0} =
 1355: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0), "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1356:     {ok,3} =
 1357: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1358:     {ok,12} =
 1359: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,12), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1360:     {ok,3} =
 1361: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1362:     %% Try the {bof,X} notation
 1363:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{bof,3}),
 1364:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1365: 
 1366:     %% Try eof positions
 1367:     io:format("EOF positions"),
 1368:     {ok,8} =
 1369: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,0}), eof=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1370:     {ok,7} =
 1371: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-1}),
 1372:     "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1373:     {ok,0} =
 1374: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-8}), "A"=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1375:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-9}),
 1376: 
 1377:     [] = flush(),
 1378:     ok.
 1379: 
 1380: pos2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1381:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1382:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1383: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1384: 			 ++"_pos2.fil"),
 1385:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1386:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1387:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1388:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1389:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,-1),
 1390: 
 1391:     %% Make sure that we still can search after an error.
 1392:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 0),
 1393:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, {bof,3}),
 1394:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1395: 
 1396:     [] = flush(),
 1397:     io:format("DONE"),
 1398:     ok.
 1399: 
 1400: %% When it does not use raw mode, file:position had a bug.
 1401: pos3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1402:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1403:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, "realmen.html.gz"),
 1404: 
 1405:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, binary]),
 1406:     {ok, _}  = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd, 5),
 1407:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {bof, -1}),
 1408: 
 1409:     %% Here ok had returned =(
 1410:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {cur, -10}),
 1411:     %% That test is actually questionable since file:position/2
 1412:     %% is documented to leave the file position undefined after
 1413:     %% it has returned an error.  But on Posix systems the position
 1414:     %% is guaranteed to be unchanged after an error return.  On e.g
 1415:     %% Windows there is nothing stated about this in the documentation.
 1416: 
 1417:     ok.
 1418: 
 1419: file_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1420:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1421: 
 1422:     %% Create a short file.
 1423:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1424: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1425:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1426:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1427:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1428:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1429: 
 1430:     %% Don't crash the file server when passing incorrect arguments.
 1431:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [{time, gurka}]),
 1432:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info([#{} | gaffel]),
 1433: 
 1434:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1435:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1436:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1437:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1438:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1439: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1440:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1441:     Size = 7,
 1442:     Type = regular,
 1443:     read_write = Access,
 1444:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1445: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1446: 				      Config))) < 2,
 1447:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1448: 
 1449:     [] = flush(),
 1450:     ok.
 1451: 
 1452: file_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1453:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1454:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1455:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1456:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1457: 
 1458:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1459:     test_directory(RootDir, read_write),
 1460: 
 1461:     %% Note that on Windows file systems, 
 1462:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1463:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1464:     %% directories.
 1465:     case os:type() of
 1466:         {win32, _} ->
 1467:             test_directory("/", read_write),
 1468:             test_directory("c:/", read_write),
 1469:             test_directory("c:\\", read_write),
 1470:             test_directory("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1471:         _ ->
 1472:             test_directory("/", read)
 1473:     end,
 1474:     ok.
 1475: 
 1476: test_directory(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1477:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1478:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1479:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1480:                atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1481:     io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1482:     io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1483:     io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1484:     io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1485: 	      [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1486:     Type = directory,
 1487:     Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1488:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1489:     [] = flush(),
 1490:     ok.
 1491: 
 1492: all_integers([{A,B,C}|T]) ->
 1493:     all_integers([A,B,C|T]);
 1494: all_integers([Int|Rest]) when is_integer(Int) ->
 1495:     all_integers(Rest);
 1496: all_integers([]) -> ok.
 1497: 
 1498: %% Try something nonexistent.
 1499: 
 1500: file_info_bad(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1501:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1502:     FileName = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nonexistent"),
 1503:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName),
 1504:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName, [raw]),
 1505:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(""),
 1506:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info("", [raw]),
 1507:     [] = flush(),
 1508:     ok.
 1509: 
 1510: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1511: 
 1512: file_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1513:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1514:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1515:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1516:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1517:       1,2,
 1518:       fun() -> file_info_int(Config) end),
 1519:     ok.
 1520: 
 1521: file_info_int(Config) ->
 1522:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1523:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1524:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1525: 
 1526:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1527:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1528: 
 1529:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1530: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1531:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1532:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1533:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1534: 
 1535:     %% check that the file got a modify date max a few seconds away from now
 1536:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1537:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1538: 
 1539:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1540:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1541:     %% sync to force it.
 1542:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1543: 
 1544:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1545: 
 1546:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1547:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1548:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1549:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1550: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1551: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1552:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1553: 
 1554:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1555:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1556:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1557:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1558: 
 1559:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1560:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1561:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1562:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1563:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1564:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2,
 1565:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1566:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1567: 
 1568:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1569:     Size = 3,
 1570:     Access = read_write,
 1571: 
 1572:     %% Do some directory checking
 1573:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir),
 1574:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir, [raw]),
 1575:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1576:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3,
 1577:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1578:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1579:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1580:     DAccess = read_write,
 1581:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1582: 
 1583:     [] = flush(),
 1584:     ok.
 1585: 
 1586: %% Filter access times, to copy with a deficiency of FAT file systems
 1587: %% (on Windows): The access time is actually only a date.
 1588: 
 1589: filter_atime(Atime, Config) ->
 1590:     case lists:member(no_access_time, Config) of
 1591: 	true ->
 1592: 	    case Atime of
 1593: 	    	{Date, _} ->
 1594: 		    {Date, {0, 0, 0}};
 1595: 		{Y, M, D, _, _, _} ->
 1596: 		    {Y, M, D, 0, 0, 0}
 1597: 	    end;
 1598: 	false ->
 1599: 	    Atime
 1600:     end.
 1601: 
 1602: %% Test read_file_info on I/O devices.
 1603: 
 1604: file_handle_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1605:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1606: 
 1607:     %% Create a short file.
 1608:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1609: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1610: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1611:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1612:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1613:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1614: 
 1615:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1616:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1617: 
 1618:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1619:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd),
 1620:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1621: 
 1622:     {ok, FdRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1623:     {ok,FileInfoRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FdRaw),
 1624:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FdRaw),
 1625: 
 1626:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1627: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo = FileInfoRaw,
 1628:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1629:     Size = 7,
 1630:     Type = regular,
 1631:     read_write = Access,
 1632:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1633: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1634: 				      Config))) < 5,
 1635:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1636: 
 1637:     [] = flush(),
 1638:     ok.
 1639: 
 1640: file_handle_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1641:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1642:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1643:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1644:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1645: 
 1646:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1647:     test_directory_handle(RootDir, read_write),
 1648: 
 1649:     %% Note that on Windows file systems,
 1650:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1651:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1652:     %% directories.
 1653:     case os:type() of
 1654:         {win32, _} ->
 1655:             test_directory_handle("/", read_write),
 1656:             test_directory_handle("c:/", read_write),
 1657:             test_directory_handle("c:\\", read_write),
 1658:             test_directory_handle("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1659:         _ ->
 1660:             test_directory_handle("/", read)
 1661:     end,
 1662:     ok.
 1663: 
 1664: test_directory_handle(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1665:     {ok, DirFd} = file:open(Name, [read, directory]),
 1666:     try
 1667:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd),
 1668:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd, [raw]),
 1669:         #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1670:                    atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1671:         io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1672:         io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1673:         io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1674:         io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1675:                   [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1676:         Type = directory,
 1677:         Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1678:         all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1679:         [] = flush(),
 1680:         ok
 1681:     after
 1682:         file:close(DirFd)
 1683:     end.
 1684: 
 1685: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1686: 
 1687: file_handle_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1688:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1689:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1690:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1691:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1692:       1,2,
 1693:       fun() -> file_handle_info_int(Config) end),
 1694:     ok.
 1695: 
 1696: file_handle_info_int(Config) ->
 1697:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1698:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1699:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1700: 
 1701:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1702:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1703: 
 1704:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1705: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1706: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1707:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1708:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1709:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1),
 1710:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1711: 
 1712:     {ok,Fd1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1713:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1Raw),
 1714:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1Raw),
 1715: 
 1716:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1717:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1718:     %% sync to force it.
 1719:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1720: 
 1721:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1722: 
 1723:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1724:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1725:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1726:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1727: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1728: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1729:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1730: 
 1731:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1732:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1733:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1734:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1735: 
 1736:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1737: 
 1738:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1739:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2),
 1740:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1741: 
 1742:     {ok,Fd2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1743:     {ok,FileInfo2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2Raw),
 1744:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2Raw),
 1745: 
 1746:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1747:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2 = FileInfo2Raw,
 1748:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1749:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1750: 
 1751:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1752:     Size = 3,
 1753:     Access = read_write,
 1754: 
 1755:     %% Do some directory checking
 1756: 
 1757:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory]),
 1758:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3),
 1759:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1760: 
 1761:     {ok,Fd3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory, raw]),
 1762:     {ok,FileInfo3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3Raw),
 1763:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3Raw),
 1764: 
 1765:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1766:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3 = FileInfo3Raw,
 1767:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1768:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1769:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1770:     DAccess = read_write,
 1771:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1772: 
 1773:     [] = flush(),
 1774:     ok.
 1775: 
 1776: %% Test the write_file_info/2 function.
 1777: 
 1778: file_write_file_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1779:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1780:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1781: 
 1782:     %% Set the file to read only AND update the file times at the same time.
 1783:     %% (This used to fail on Windows NT/95 for a local filesystem.)
 1784:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1785: 
 1786:     Name1 = filename:join(RootDir,
 1787: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1788: 			  ++"_write_file_info_ro"),
 1789:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello"),
 1790:     Time = {{1997, 01, 02}, {12, 35, 42}},
 1791:     Info = #file_info{mode=8#400, atime=Time, mtime=Time, ctime=Time},
 1792:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, Info),
 1793: 
 1794:     %% Read back the times.
 1795: 
 1796:     {ok, ActualInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1797:     #file_info{mode=_Mode, atime=ActAtime, mtime=Time,
 1798: 	       ctime=ActCtime} = ActualInfo,
 1799:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(Time, Config),
 1800:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(ActAtime, Config),
 1801:     case os:type() of
 1802: 	{win32, _} ->
 1803: 	    %% On Windows, "ctime" means creation time and it can
 1804: 	    %% be set.
 1805: 	    ActCtime = Time;
 1806: 	_ ->
 1807: 	    ok
 1808:     end,
 1809:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1810: 
 1811:     %% Make the file writable again.
 1812: 
 1813:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1814:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1815: 
 1816:     %% And unwritable.
 1817:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}),
 1818:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1819: 
 1820:     %% Same with raw.
 1821:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}, [raw]),
 1822:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1823:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}, [raw]),
 1824:     {error,eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1825: 
 1826:     %% Write the times again.
 1827:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1828: 
 1829:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1830:     NewInfo = #file_info{atime=NewTime, mtime=NewTime, ctime=NewTime},
 1831:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, NewInfo),
 1832:     {ok, ActualInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1833:     #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime,
 1834: 	       ctime=NewActCtime} = ActualInfo2,
 1835:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1836:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1837:     case os:type() of
 1838: 	{win32, _} -> NewActCtime = NewTime;
 1839: 	_ -> ok
 1840:     end,
 1841: 
 1842:     %% The file should still be unwritable.
 1843:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1844: 
 1845:     %% Make the file writeable again, so that we can remove the
 1846:     %% test suites ... :-)
 1847:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1848: 
 1849:     [] = flush(),
 1850:     ok.
 1851: 
 1852: file_wfi_helpers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1853:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1854:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1855: 
 1856:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1857:                          atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_wfi_helpers"),
 1858: 
 1859:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1860:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1861:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_time(Name, NewTime, NewTime),
 1862: 
 1863:     {ok, #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime}} =
 1864:         ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1865: 
 1866:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1867:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1868: 
 1869:     %% Make the file unwritable
 1870:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#400),
 1871:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1872: 
 1873:     %% ... and writable again
 1874:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#600),
 1875:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1876: 
 1877:     %% We have no idea which users will work, so all we can do is to check
 1878:     %% that it returns enoent instead of crashing.
 1879:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_group("bogus file name", 0),
 1880:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_owner("bogus file name", 0),
 1881: 
 1882:     [] = flush(),
 1883:     ok.
 1884: 
 1885: %% Returns a directory on a file system that has correct file times.
 1886: 
 1887: get_good_directory(Config) ->
 1888:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1889: 
 1890: 
 1891: consult1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1892:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1893:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1894: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1895: 			 ++"_consult.fil"),
 1896:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1897:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1898:     io:format(Fd1,
 1899: 	      "{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n\"into\". (sound). ",
 1900: 	      []),
 1901:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1902:     {ok,[{this,[is,1.0],journey},"into",sound]} =
 1903: 	?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1904: 
 1905:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1906:     %% note the missing double quote
 1907:     io:format(
 1908:       Fd2,"{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n \"into. (sound). ",[]),
 1909:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1910:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1911:     io:format("Errmsg: ~p",[Msg]),
 1912: 
 1913:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1914: 
 1915:     [] = flush(),
 1916:     ok.
 1917: 
 1918: path_consult(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1919:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1920:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_consult.fil",
 1921:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1922:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1923:     io:format(Fd1,"{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}.\n",[]),
 1924:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1925:     %% File last in path
 1926:     {ok,[{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}],Dir} =
 1927: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(
 1928: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1929: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1930: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1931: 	    RootDir], FileName),
 1932:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1933: 
 1934:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1935:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1936:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1937:     {ok,_,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(["nosuch1","nosuch2"],Name),
 1938: 
 1939:     [] = flush(),
 1940:     ok.
 1941: 
 1942: 
 1943: eval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1944:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1945:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1946: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_eval.fil"),
 1947:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1948:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1949:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,\ntrue). ",[]),
 1950:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1951:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1952:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1953: 
 1954:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1955:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1956:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,\nR). ",[]),
 1957:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1958:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(
 1959: 	    Name,
 1960: 	    erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 1961:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1962: 
 1963:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1964:     %% garbled
 1965:     io:format(Fd3,"puGARBLED-GARBLED\ntrue). ",[]),
 1966:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1967:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1968:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 1969: 
 1970:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1971: 
 1972:     [] = flush(),
 1973:     ok.
 1974: 
 1975: path_eval(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1976:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1977:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_eval.fil",
 1978:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1979:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1980:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,true).\n",[]),
 1981:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1982:     %% File last in path
 1983:     {ok,Dir} =
 1984: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 1985: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1986: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1987: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1988: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 1989:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1990:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1991: 
 1992:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1993:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1994:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1995:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1996:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,R).\n",[]),
 1997:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1998:     {ok,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 1999: 		["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2000: 		Name,
 2001: 		erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2002: 
 2003:     [] = flush(),
 2004:     ok.
 2005: 
 2006: 
 2007: script1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2008:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2009:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2010: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_script.fil"),
 2011:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2012:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2013:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2014:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2015:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2016: 
 2017:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2018:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2019:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2020:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2021:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(
 2022: 		 Name,
 2023: 		 erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2024: 
 2025:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2026:     io:format(Fd3,"A = 11,\nB = six,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2027:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 2028:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2029:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 2030: 
 2031:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 2032: 
 2033:     [] = flush(),
 2034:     ok.
 2035: 
 2036: path_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2037:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2038:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_script.fil",
 2039:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 2040:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2041:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B.\n",[]),
 2042:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2043:     %% File last in path
 2044:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2045: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2046: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 2047: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 2048: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 2049: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 2050:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 2051: 
 2052:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 2053:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 2054:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 2055:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2056:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B.",[]),
 2057:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2058:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2059: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2060: 	   ["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2061: 	   Name,
 2062: 	   erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2063: 
 2064:     [] = flush(),
 2065:     ok.

 2069: truncate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2070:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2071:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2072: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2073: 			 ++"_truncate.fil"),
 2074: 
 2075:     %% Create a file with some data.
 2076:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
 2077:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
 2078: 
 2079:     %% Truncate the file to 10 characters.
 2080:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read_write),
 2081:     {ok, 10} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, 10),
 2082:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd),
 2083:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2084: 
 2085:     %% Read back the file and check that it has been truncated.
 2086:     Expected = list_to_binary("0123456789"),
 2087:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
 2088: 
 2089:     %% Open the file read only and verify that it is not possible to
 2090:     %% truncate it, OTP-1960
 2091:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 2092:     {ok, 5} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 2093:     {error, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 2094: 
 2095:     [] = flush(),
 2096:     ok.
 2097: 
 2098: 
 2099: %% Tests that ?FILE_MODULE:datasync/1 at least doesn't crash.
 2100: datasync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2101:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2102:     Sync = filename:join(PrivDir,
 2103: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2104: 			 ++"_sync.fil"),
 2105: 
 2106:     %% Raw open.
 2107:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write, raw]),
 2108:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd),
 2109:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2110: 
 2111:     %% Ordinary open.
 2112:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write]),
 2113:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 2114:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2115: 
 2116:     [] = flush(),
 2117:     ok.
